WRITING.TEXT: Thanks for the info.
When did this happen?

Thanks! The developer shared a lot of stuff with me, and I have a reason to believe that nothing shady is happening (from a privacy standpoint) -- which is why I chose not to report it on the site. But still, data usage is a thing that Talon users should keep an eye on.

I agree. I have been looking for a Twitter app that makes sense to me. I have literally tried a dozen of them, and I don't know, for whatever reason, the official app just seems the best. I also find the "night mode" awesome.

Hi,
The developer and owner of the app has since responded to me, here's the statement he provided:
"I made changes, and released an update, last night that will forcefully restart the app if it detects random data spikes, to close the data connection. I had about 5 reports this week of anywhere from 600 MB - 4 GB spikes. I saw your tweet toward me this morning, nothing like that will happen again."
Fixed.

WRITING.TITLE: Talon for Android is consuming a lot of data
WRITING.TEXT:
Hi, this is Manish Singh, freelancer with CNET. For the past two days, I have been noticing that my Nexus 6's battery was dying every 5-6 hours of moderate usage. After doing some investigation, I found that Talon app had used [more than 96GB of data during the same period](https://twitter.com/refsrc/status/761201948628389888). I thought maybe it's an isolated case, but turns out some other users [have also complained](https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B6B4X7fZNYOlZEhiXzBlUUUyWVU/view?usp=sharing) about it on Talon's Google Play listing. I am awaiting Talon's response, but in the meantime, if you use this app, I would urge you to go to Settings and see if anything weird is happening at your end as well.
Note: I'm identifying myself only to ensure that people know I don't work for a rival app.

WRITING.TEXT: Except I don't live in the States, and have a carrier that offers 250GB plan + I buy more data when I need more.

I would usually consume 120-150GB of data in a month. (I stream a lot of YouTube and Netflix). But thanks to the Xbox One, my monthly data consumption has been between 200-250GBGB for the last couple of months.
